name: cifti-create-dense-from-template
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Create cifti with matching dense map.

This command helps you make a new dscalar, dtseries, or dlabel cifti file that matches the brainordinate space used in another cifti file.  The template file must have the desired brainordinate space in the mapping along the column direction (for dtseries, dscalar, dlabel, and symmetric dconn this is always the case).  All input cifti files must have a brain models mapping along column and use the same volume space and/or surface vertex count as the template for structures that they contain.  If any input files contain label data, then input files with non-label data are not allowed, and the -series option may not be used.

Any structure that isn't covered by an input is filled with zeros or the unlabeled key.

The <structure> argument of -metric, -label or -volume must be one of the following:

CORTEX_LEFT
CORTEX_RIGHT
CEREBELLUM
ACCUMBENS_LEFT
ACCUMBENS_RIGHT
ALL_GREY_MATTER
ALL_WHITE_MATTER
AMYGDALA_LEFT
AMYGDALA_RIGHT
BRAIN_STEM
CAUDATE_LEFT
CAUDATE_RIGHT
CEREBELLAR_WHITE_MATTER_LEFT
CEREBELLAR_WHITE_MATTER_RIGHT
CEREBELLUM_LEFT
CEREBELLUM_RIGHT
CEREBRAL_WHITE_MATTER_LEFT
CEREBRAL_WHITE_MATTER_RIGHT
CORTEX
DIENCEPHALON_VENTRAL_LEFT
DIENCEPHALON_VENTRAL_RIGHT
HIPPOCAMPUS_LEFT
HIPPOCAMPUS_RIGHT
INVALID
OTHER
OTHER_GREY_MATTER
OTHER_WHITE_MATTER
PALLIDUM_LEFT
PALLIDUM_RIGHT
PUTAMEN_LEFT
PUTAMEN_RIGHT
THALAMUS_LEFT
THALAMUS_RIGHT

The argument to -unit must be one of the following:

SECOND
HERTZ
METER
RADIAN

inputs.name: template_cifti
inputs.description: file to match brainordinates of

inputs.name: cifti_out
inputs.description: the output cifti file

inputs.name: series
inputs.description: make a dtseries file instead of a dscalar

type.name: series
type.description: make a dtseries file instead of a dscalar

inputs.name: step
inputs.description: increment between series points

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: start value of the series

inputs.name: opt_unit_unit
inputs.description: select unit for series (default SECOND): unit identifier

inputs.name: volume_all
inputs.description: specify an input volume file for all voxel data

type.name: volume_all
type.description: specify an input volume file for all voxel data

inputs.name: volume_in
inputs.description: the input volume file

inputs.name: opt_from_cropped
inputs.description: the input is cropped to the size of the voxel data in the template file

inputs.name: opt_label_collision_action
inputs.description: how to handle conflicts between label keys: 'ERROR', 'SURFACES_FIRST', or 'LEGACY', default 'ERROR', use 'LEGACY' to match v1.4.2 and earlier

inputs.name: cifti
inputs.description: use input data from a cifti file

type.name: cifti
type.description: use input data from a cifti file

inputs.name: cifti_in
inputs.description: cifti file containing input data

inputs.name: metric
inputs.description: use input data from a metric file

type.name: metric
type.description: use input data from a metric file

inputs.name: structure
inputs.description: which structure to put the metric file into

inputs.name: metric_in
inputs.description: input metric file

inputs.name: label
inputs.description: use input data from surface label files

type.name: label
type.description: use input data from surface label files

inputs.name: structure
inputs.description: which structure to put the label file into

inputs.name: label_in
inputs.description: input label file

inputs.name: volume
inputs.description: use a volume file for a single volume structure's data

type.name: volume
type.description: use a volume file for a single volume structure's data

inputs.name: structure
inputs.description: which structure to put the volume file into

inputs.name: volume_in
inputs.description: the input volume file

inputs.name: opt_from_cropped
inputs.description: the input is cropped to the size of the volume structure
